summary: The Flamethrower, The Spider, And The Soldier
title: The Flamethrower, The Spider, And The Soldier
description:
by johndeaconuwu

Elias was born in 1913 and raised in Scotland. She she lived with her two little brothers, one older brother, and her mom and dad. When she was six years old, men dressed in black killed her family and kidnapped her. Elias was a mutant, she could create and control fire, her mind was wiped and she was trained to kill. Then she was put on ice for 23 years.

When the Winter Soldier came, and she was woken up. He trained her, they became like a family, then when she was 13, she was put on ice. Jump to 2017, a New mutant has been taken in. And Elias (The Flamethrower) Was woken up.

Words: 759, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

blog.description: Hey I’m Harp // aroacewritingplace on ao3 // He Made Me Who I Am - a Parley fic // send prompts? I’ll write ‘em

summary: He Made Me Who I Am, Chapter Six
body:
He Made Me Who I Am, Chapter Six

He Made Me Who I Am Chapter Six: New York, New York, is out now!

Harley was so glad he decided to go.


Kir had texted him, the previous night, let him know that he was supposed to come to the garage. He told Kir that he wasn’t going to show up, much to her frustration. As he explained to her, of course he wanted to get back to their work as soon as he could, but he sorta had a date.


A date?


Harley wasn’t sure. It sort of felt like a date, when Peter grabbed his arm and dragged him down a side street to point out some crazy graffiti he found once or into a little shop that Harley would have missed had he been walking around on his own. The action made his heart skip a beat, and Harley wasn’t sure what to make of it. Because there were also the times where they were just walking, and their fingers would brush, but neither of them moved their hands any more than that.


Harley stole a glance at Peter, but he was always talking, gesticulating with his left hand at the street, the sky, the buildings. Harley thought he could listen to Peter talk forever, let that strong, excited voice of his carry him off to sleep, he wouldn’t mind if Peter never stopped talking.

Want to read more? Continue on ao3

summary:
irondad headcanon: birthday cake
It all starts because Rhodey and Pepper both cancel at the same time
On Tony’s birthday
They...
body:
irondad headcanon: birthday cake

  • It all starts because Rhodey and Pepper both cancel at the same time
  • On Tony’s birthday
  • They have legitimate excuses, of course (they would never just leave Tony high and dry like that) 
  • Nonetheless, it means that Tony is all alone
  • That is, until Peter Parker comes bounding through the door with a box of cake mix, one of those noisemakers with the streamers on the end, and a stupid grin on his face
  • If you asked Pepper or Rhodey which one had informed the kid about the situation, they’d laugh and say they didn’t know what you were talking about
  • In reality, they’d both called Peter, because Tony might not admit it in words but he really liked having him around
  • And that is how Tony Stark ended up covered in chocolate batter and sprinkles in the Avengers’ kitchen at four in the afternoon
  • “Peter, there is cake mix on the ceiling.” 
  • The kid just gives a sheepish smile and blows into the noisemaker again
  • God, he wants to be mad at Pepper and Rhodey for making him babysit on his birthday, but one look at Peter Parker–chocolate on his nose from licking the bowl clean–makes him forget his train of thought
  • One-and-a-half hours later the cake is done cooling, and in Peter’s sloppy handwriting the green icing reads Happy Birthday Mr. Stark!
  • He also painstakingly sticks forty-six candles into the top, making a show of counting them out and earning a smack from Tony
  • When the candles–all of them–are blown out and removed, Tony cuts them both a slice and takes a bite… and nearly chokes
  • He looks at the box again and immediately sees the problem: it’s chocolate and coconut flavored
  • And Tony Stark is allergic to coconut
  • But he eats the whole thing anyway, pops a few Benadryl in his mouth when Peter isn’t looking and pulls his shirt up to hide the rash sneaking across his neck
  • Because Peter looks so genuinely happy and, rash or not, Tony is too, and he’s not about to ruin this moment
  • The problem, however, is that it becomes a tradition
  • For the next three years, Peter Parker comes over to the Compound on Tony’s birthday and gets chocolate-coconut batter on the ceiling and all over his face
  • And every year, Tony chokes down a slice of the death cake just to see the kid smile
  • Rhodey says he’s whipped
  • Tony doesn’t care
  • He also threatens to sit on him if he ever spills the secret to Peter
  • Peter doesn’t hear the truth until it’s Tony’s 49th birthday, and for the first time, Tony isn’t around to help him make the cake
  • He goes to the Compound anyway, sees the chocolate stains on the ceiling from previous years and grins as he imagines Tony giving him grief
  • Pepper and Morgan and Rhodey join him in the kitchen as he finishes it up, the adults carefully placing all forty-nine candles into the top while he helps Morgan scribble something resembling Happy Birthday Tony in familiar green icing
  • “He really loved you, you know,” Pepper says when it’s all done, a sad glint to her smile
  • Peter does what he’s been doing for the last couple of months, nodding his head at the sentiment, but not truly believing it
  • He knows what Tony meant to him, but he’s not quite sure he’ll ever know exactly what he meant to Tony, because Tony had never said it
  • And now he’d never get the chance to
  • He goes to cut four slices, but Pepper stops him
  • “Oh, Morgan can’t have any, she’s allergic to coconut.”
  • The little girl scrunches her face together
  • “Yea, daddy says coc-a-nut is icky.”
  • Peter whips his head up to stare down the two adults currently sharing a look
  • “Um, I’m sorry, but what did she just say?”
  • Pepper and Rhodey chuckle softly because the cat’s outta the bag now
  • “Well, uh, Tony was allergic to coconut, too.”
  • “Excuse me?”
  • “Yea,” Rhodes explains, “Nothing crazy. Just gave him this gross rash on his neck. But he ate it every year, even when you were… gone. He said it reminded him of you.”
  • Peter lets that thought sink in
  • He pictures Tony Stark suffering an allergic reaction, on his birthday, for the last eight years
  • All because of him
  • And then Peter can’t help but laugh
  • Because it’s ridiculous, and completely lacking in self-preservation, and so incredibly Tony
  • Because Tony Stark showed Peter Parker that he loved him via chocolate-coconut cake
  • And Peter wouldn’t want it any other way

  • “Yea,” Rhodes explains, “Nothing crazy. Just gave him this gross rash on his neck. But he ate it every year, even when you were… gone. He said it reminded him of you.”
  • Peter lets that thought sink in
  • He pictures Tony Stark suffering an allergic reaction, on his birthday, for the last eight years
  • All because of him
  • And then Peter can’t help but laugh
  • Because it’s ridiculous, and completely lacking in self-preservation, and so incredibly Tony
  • Because Tony Stark showed Peter Parker that he loved him via chocolate-coconut cake
  • And Peter wouldn’t want it any other way

trail.content_raw:
irondad headcanon: birthday cake

  • It all starts because Rhodey and Pepper both cancel at the same time
  • On Tony’s birthday
  • They have legitimate excuses, of course (they would never just leave Tony high and dry like that) 
  • Nonetheless, it means that Tony is all alone
  • That is, until Peter Parker comes bounding through the door with a box of cake mix, one of those noisemakers with the streamers on the end, and a stupid grin on his face
  • If you asked Pepper or Rhodey which one had informed the kid about the situation, they’d laugh and say they didn’t know what you were talking about
  • In reality, they’d both called Peter, because Tony might not admit it in words but he really liked having him around
  • And that is how Tony Stark ended up covered in chocolate batter and sprinkles in the Avengers’ kitchen at four in the afternoon
  • “Peter, there is cake mix on the ceiling.” 
  • The kid just gives a sheepish smile and blows into the noisemaker again
  • God, he wants to be mad at Pepper and Rhodey for making him babysit on his birthday, but one look at Peter Parker–chocolate on his nose from licking the bowl clean–makes him forget his train of thought
  • One-and-a-half hours later the cake is done cooling, and in Peter’s sloppy handwriting the green icing reads Happy Birthday Mr. Stark!
  • He also painstakingly sticks forty-six candles into the top, making a show of counting them out and earning a smack from Tony
  • When the candles–all of them–are blown out and removed, Tony cuts them both a slice and takes a bite… and nearly chokes
  • He looks at the box again and immediately sees the problem: it’s chocolate and coconut flavored
  • And Tony Stark is allergic to coconut
  • But he eats the whole thing anyway, pops a few Benadryl in his mouth when Peter isn’t looking and pulls his shirt up to hide the rash sneaking across his neck
  • Because Peter looks so genuinely happy and, rash or not, Tony is too, and he’s not about to ruin this moment
  • The problem, however, is that it becomes a tradition
  • For the next three years, Peter Parker comes over to the Compound on Tony’s birthday and gets chocolate-coconut batter on the ceiling and all over his face
  • And every year, Tony chokes down a slice of the death cake just to see the kid smile
  • Rhodey says he’s whipped
  • Tony doesn’t care
  • He also threatens to sit on him if he ever spills the secret to Peter
  • Peter doesn’t hear the truth until it’s Tony’s 49th birthday, and for the first time, Tony isn’t around to help him make the cake
  • He goes to the Compound anyway, sees the chocolate stains on the ceiling from previous years and grins as he imagines Tony giving him grief
  • Pepper and Morgan and Rhodey join him in the kitchen as he finishes it up, the adults carefully placing all forty-nine candles into the top while he helps Morgan scribble something resembling Happy Birthday Tony in familiar green icing
  • “He really loved you, you know,” Pepper says when it’s all done, a sad glint to her smile
  • Peter does what he’s been doing for the last couple of months, nodding his head at the sentiment, but not truly believing it
  • He knows what Tony meant to him, but he’s not quite sure he’ll ever know exactly what he meant to Tony, because Tony had never said it
  • And now he’d never get the chance to
  • He goes to cut four slices, but Pepper stops him
  • “Oh, Morgan can’t have any, she’s allergic to coconut.”
  • The little girl scrunches her face together
  • “Yea, daddy says coc-a-nut is icky.”
  • Peter whips his head up to stare down the two adults currently sharing a look
  • “Um, I’m sorry, but what did she just say?”
  • Pepper and Rhodey chuckle softly because the cat’s outta the bag now
  • “Well, uh, Tony was allergic to coconut, too.”
  • “Excuse me?”
  • “Yea,” Rhodes explains, “Nothing crazy. Just gave him this gross rash on his neck. But he ate it every year, even when you were… gone. He said it reminded him of you.”
  • Peter lets that thought sink in
  • He pictures Tony Stark suffering an allergic reaction, on his birthday, for the last eight years
  • All because of him
  • And then Peter can’t help but laugh
  • Because it’s ridiculous, and completely lacking in self-preservation, and so incredibly Tony
  • Because Tony Stark showed Peter Parker that he loved him via chocolate-coconut cake
  • And Peter wouldn’t want it any other way

summary:
Here is a headcanon for your consideration: Peter Parker is so adorable everyone wants to protect him, even the bad guys. 
Like...
body:
Here is a headcanon for your consideration: Peter Parker is so adorable everyone wants to protect him, even the bad guys.

Like suddenly Mysterio is following Peter everywhere and trying to keep him safe and he has no idea why the hell is he doing that.

He was just supposed to defeat spiderman not to become his personal bodyguard.

summary: Welcome To Mysterio's Marvelous Multiverse
title: Welcome To Mysterio's Marvelous Multiverse
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2EXE9Vt

by Grace_d

[Endgame compliant, Far from home A/U (probably)]

“Woah.” Spider-Man breathes. “Trip Advisor did not mention this.”

In the middle of the room hangs a flat circle of energy, kinetic electricity twisting from the edges into the centre, reflecting off the puddles on the floor. Green smoke swirls across the floor, licking up the wall he’s attached to. It’s definitely creepy enough to be a portal to another dimension.

Peter Parker’s trip to Europe was supposed to cap off his recovery from the traumatic events of the past (5?) years, kick off his summer vacation and celebrate his decision to return to friendly neighbourhood crime-fighting.

Instead, Nick Fury found him. Not ideal, not relaxing, and definitely above this web-slingers pay grade. (Was he even getting paid?).

So when Quentin Beck AKA Mysterio suggests an inter-dimensional field trip, it’s a hard pass from Spider-Man. He’s sticking to the mission. Even if it means giving up the chance to see Tony Stark again.

Too bad he didn’t have a choice in the matter.

Will add tags as I go

summary: Small Pepterony Fluff
body:
Small Pepterony Fluff


Peter smiles and leans into Pepper, as they start the movie. Avengers movie night has always been Peter’s favorite part of living at the tower.

Pepper wraps her arms around Peter and kisses him on the lips, smiling into it. “You can’t fall asleep during this movie, it’s my favorite!”

Peter rolls his eyes. “I thought Silence of the Lambs was your favorite?”

Pepper giggles and nuzzles his neck. “That’s my favorite horror. This is my favorite action movie.”

Natasha frowns and sits next to them, pulling Peter closer to her. “So, kid, do you have any crushes?”

Peter blushes and stutters. “That’s o-out of the blue.” He says.

Nat shrugs. “I got curious.”

Peter swallows thickly. “I uh- yeah, actually. A couple.” He cant help but smirk at his pun.

Tony comes in with a bowl of popcorn, plopping down next to Pepper. “Alright, ehat movie are we watching?”

Pepper leans into him. “Men in Black.” She says happily.

Peter sighs as he looks at them. He really doesn’t want to keep this a secret.

Natasha pulls Peter closer to herself. “So, kid, is your crush from school? Another college student? Someone your age or younger?”

Peter frowns. “No, actually. I don’t like people my age or younger.”

Nat hums. “Hopefully your crush isn’t married, then.”

Pepper looks over and frowns. She saw her kiss Peter. She must have.

Peter blushes more. “What about you, who are you crushing on?” He pushes her away and stands.

Pepper pulls Peter into her lap, petting his hair. “The movie is starting, be quiet.” She says.

Tony smirks and feeds a piece of popcorn to Peter. Then he kisses Peter on the lips, because he’s also tired of hiding this and he’s never been good at secrets.

Pepper smiles and kisses Peter on the lips, and then Tony.

Natasha stares, face expressionless.

Peter blushes and smiles brightly. He turns to Nat. “Yeah, my crushes are married.”

reblog.comment:
Small Pepterony Fluff


Peter smiles and leans into Pepper, as they start the movie. Avengers movie night has always been Peter’s favorite part of living at the tower.

Pepper wraps her arms around Peter and kisses him on the lips, smiling into it. “You can’t fall asleep during this movie, it’s my favorite!”

Peter rolls his eyes. “I thought Silence of the Lambs was your favorite?”

Pepper giggles and nuzzles his neck. “That’s my favorite horror. This is my favorite action movie.”

Natasha frowns and sits next to them, pulling Peter closer to her. “So, kid, do you have any crushes?”

Peter blushes and stutters. “That’s o-out of the blue.” He says.

Nat shrugs. “I got curious.”

Peter swallows thickly. “I uh- yeah, actually. A couple.” He cant help but smirk at his pun.

Tony comes in with a bowl of popcorn, plopping down next to Pepper. “Alright, ehat movie are we watching?”

Pepper leans into him. “Men in Black.” She says happily.

Peter sighs as he looks at them. He really doesn’t want to keep this a secret.

Natasha pulls Peter closer to herself. “So, kid, is your crush from school? Another college student? Someone your age or younger?”

Peter frowns. “No, actually. I don’t like people my age or younger.”

Nat hums. “Hopefully your crush isn’t married, then.”

Pepper looks over and frowns. She saw her kiss Peter. She must have.

Peter blushes more. “What about you, who are you crushing on?” He pushes her away and stands.

Pepper pulls Peter into her lap, petting his hair. “The movie is starting, be quiet.” She says.

Tony smirks and feeds a piece of popcorn to Peter. Then he kisses Peter on the lips, because he’s also tired of hiding this and he’s never been good at secrets.

Pepper smiles and kisses Peter on the lips, and then Tony.

Natasha stares, face expressionless.

Peter blushes and smiles brightly. He turns to Nat. “Yeah, my crushes are married.”

blog.name: hellzyeahthewebwieldingavenger
blog.title: Hellz Yeah, Spider-Man: The Web Wielding Avenger
blog.description:
A blog all about my love for Peter Benjamin Parker, his friends, family, enemies and world in general. Expect images, rants, musings and long winded essays of the Web Head and why I think he's the greatest comic book Superhero of all time. 

I LOVE comments and questions so leave some as you pass by as well as call me on any facts I have gotten wrong.

Also check out my sub-pages for F.A.Q.s and a key for when I abbreviate.

summary: Spider-Man & the League of the Realms #2 Thoughts
title: Spider-Man & the League of the Realms #2 Thoughts
body:
Basically most of my comments from issue #1 stand. The only things of note are the following.

a)      The Angel who joins with Spider-Man could be a traitor. How compelling

b)      I found out why this series is so blasé at best. Because the League of the Realms is in fact a previously established concept not something invented for this story.

See now this mini makes sense.

This isn’t a Spider-Man mini-series so much as it is a League of the Realms mini-series in which Spider-Man is now a main character.

This is why if you didn’t know that walking into this you’d be alienated by how much panel time is given other to these random characters from Thor stories and not Spider-Man himself.

It’s a true blue team book, not a story about Spider-Man who happens to be in charge of a team.

Knowing this I will be a little less harsh on this issue and the previous one. In fact knowing what I know now, the idea of picking Spider-Man as a representative of human superheroes makes a lot of thematic sense for what the League is all about.

However…This is still a problematic book.

Because it’s still marketed clearly as a Spidey book first and foremost so Spidey fans are going to pick it up expecting Spider-Man to be a bigger deal than he is, but instead we get scenes devoted to a lesbian Viking angel’s tragic love story.

From a writing POV you could switch out Spider-Man with any other human hero who has a code against killing and it wouldn’t make much difference.

Much more problematically this series does an atrocious job of endearing new readers to the other League members. I feel like I’ve walked into a movie mid-way and should be invested in these guys and I’m absolutely not because I’ve not read their older appearances.

Every comic should be someone’s first and this story throws you in and takes a lot for granted.

It’s not even like this is X-men or Avengers where a certain amount of foreknowledge can be presumed because of cultural osmosis.

Out of the people reading this how many of you knew before this or my post on issue #1 who the hell Screwbeard even was?

summary: pick a day!
title: pick a day!
body:
I’ve outlined a good chunk of the rest of Hollow Phoenix, and I’ve realized that it is probably going to run into the semester starting. And with grad school, I’m not going to be able to upload at random and might not be able to do twice a week. 

So, I need to know which day would be good to upload for you all to read it, reblog it, comment on it and whatever else you all want to do. 

I’m currently leaning towards Fridays or Sundays, but let me know guys!

Take the survey here!
